root.text:
FYI, we just migrated NMPS (which returns SKUs for the given calories) to the new cluster on *staging*.
There shouldn't be any issue your side, but if you something is broken, please ping me :slightly_smiling_face:

<@US74TEQ3E>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Data table for dog name`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hi, what data table dog name is stored in? I'm working with the MISO team on a data pull for a Reactivation DM campaign so we can personalize the DM creative. They aren't familiar with where this data is stored so wanted to check`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text: Hi <@US74TEQ3E>, the easiest way you can get it is the Pet profile export. It contains the pet profile data from all pet profile ever created. I will send you the file in the DM, with the data updated today.

elements.text: , the easiest way you can get it is the Pet profile export. It contains the pet profile data from all pet profile ever created. I will send you the file in the DM, with the data updated today.

_thread_replies.text:
in addition the name of the data table is `private_nutritional_profile_live`
and the name is stored in `nutritional_profile_curated_ap`
(thanks <@U047SAC2PPV>)

_thread_replies.text:
<@U0829PFG3LM>, could you make the changes yourself in CCM? While this is not a lot of work, managing the copy on CCM is usually owned by the Physical Product Team :slightly_smiling_face:

the description of the product is the same as the name: as you can see usually in description we are showing weight / flavours etc.

elements.text: , could you make the changes yourself in CCM? While this is not a lot of work, managing the copy on CCM is usually owned by the Physical Product Team
the description of the product is the same as the name: as you can see usually in description we are showing weight / flavours etc.

_thread_replies.text: Also, could you tell me why are we calling the pack "small" if there is only one size? It might seem that it is not such a good value for money for users who need to pay ~60$ for something "small".

elements.text: Also, could you tell me why are we calling the pack "small" if there is only one size? It might seem that it is not such a good value for money for users who need to pay ~60$ for something "small".

_thread_replies.text:
<@U03UMPD2NNS> Ah, got it. We have these as headlines in CCM, have updated them.

Also made changes to the add-on section. In the future could the team ping me on what items / where changes are needed if new categories are created? I can't make any updates to the category level until after the team creates it and want to make sure sure I know where to update in CCM. As an example here we called it Category but in CCM this isn't labeled under the Categories section.

elements.text:
Ah, got it. We have these as headlines in CCM, have updated them.

Also made changes to the add-on section. In the future could the team ping me on what items / where changes are needed if new categories are created? I can't make any updates to the category level until after the team creates it and want to make sure sure I know where to update in CCM. As an example here we called it Category but in CCM this isn't labeled under the Categories section.

_thread_replies.text: For the small pack, we kept the same labeling we use in the HF marketplace where we sell a small vs large pack. Given we're starting with the small pack only here, I agree with you I think lets update to remove small from the title. If we move to adding the large pack, we can add that language then. WDYT?

elements.text: For the small pack, we kept the same labeling we use in the HF marketplace where we sell a small vs large pack. Given we're starting with the small pack only here, I agree with you I think lets update to remove small from the title. If we move to adding the large pack, we can add that language then. WDYT?

_thread_replies.text: Agree with the naming conventions :slightly_smiling_face:

About adding the copy in CCM - this is because of the sections deprecation. We haven't finalized the migration yet. Due to some bugs we need to fix to complete it. This is why we launched the packs as part of sections. For any new type we will add it will be nested in Categories.

Apologies on the confusion, I was under impression we already launched it.

elements.text:
About adding the copy in CCM - this is because of the sections deprecation. We haven't finalized the migration yet. Due to some bugs we need to fix to complete it. This is why we launched the packs as part of sections. For any new type we will add it will be nested in Categories.

Apologies on the confusion, I was under impression we already launched it.

_thread_replies.text: Sounds good, thanks for the clarity!

elements.text: Sounds good, thanks for the clarity!

_thread_replies.text: Names are updated on CCM
